page.title: 19The Big Waters, Seaton Burn
page.content: The{Big Waters}is a lake surrounded by a wild life reserve park and picnic area. At least two mute swans and eight cygnets live there. They are endangered species due to lead weights and pollution. There are also mallards, coots and moorhens. There is a road leading to a car park and some picnic benches.There are seats, paths, stepping stones and bridges for visitors to use.We saw a sparrow-hawk, swallows,crows,swifts,house martins, sparrows, starlings,blackbirds and a robin.Some young trees have been planted including beeches an alders. We saw marigolds, yellowflag, my lady's slipper, clover and many other flowers growing wild. The things which spoil the area are the sewers, the aeroplanes and the motorway,
